lead_paragraph: Less than a month after the N.F.L. reinstated linebacker Odell Thurman from a two-year suspension, he was waived by Cincinnati. The Bengals appeared to support Thurman during his suspension for violating the league’s substance-abuse and conduct policies. But when he did not attend voluntary on-field workouts last week, the team, which is installing a new defense, let him go. Thurman said he was in Georgia after the death of his grandmother.
